While cloning it into a new repository is possible, however users may not want to "break the Fork" of which many people like to see for many reasons.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When someone is signing up for a new Bitbucket account using an academic email address, they get a 500 error after they choose a username.

The accounts gets created in Bitbucket Cloud, but it has no email linked to it.

h3. Workaround
Open a ticket with Bitbucket Cloud Support:

* https://getsupport.atlassian.com

Please mention the username that you selected and also the email you used to create the Bitbucket account.

Support can assist with fixing the issue.
fields.summary: Users signing up for a Bitbucket Cloud account using an academic email get a 500 error

fields.description:
When user navigates between pages in "Users on Plan" page in Bitbucket Settings, it gets redirected to the wrong page instead.

Workaround

For users with that error: Browse the link below by entering the account username <account>, and you can amend the page number to navigate to that particular page.

Link : "https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<account>/plan-users/?page=4"
fields.summary: Users on plan page selector goes to wrong page (BBCDEV-7146)

fields.description:
There's currently only .net core builds for pipelines, whilst this is great for a lot of .net projects at the moment I can't use .net core (umbraco CMS is a good example).

Can we have a .net build template for templates using the full .net framework in pipeline please?

I'm trying this out for myself at home but it's something my team would like to use in work.
fields.summary: C# full .net framework pipelines

fields.description:
I am not sure how it can be implemented, but it might reduce our build times by a large margin.\\
While locally my docker builds takes 2-3 seconds, it takes more than 5 minutes on your pipelines.

Even a bitbucket hosted image repository would create awesome results because currently we are spending %80-99 of our build times with image pulling and pushing.
fields.summary: Ability to cache docker images?

fields.description: Would be good to quickly select a custom build and have the ability to clone it or edit it then execute it on the fly within the web UI - maybe I want to add dryrun or increase the logging in there or something, would help debugging problems too
fields.summary: Create or edit a pipeline build

# I was able to push files to the bitbucket url without authenticating (using VS)

When I check repo settings, the checkbox is still enabled for "This is a private repository"...

fields.description:
Using the scrollbar, it's not possible to get to the bottom of the page.

# Go to https://bitbucket.org/repo/create
# Expand Advanced Settings
# Adjust the window size so that is is smaller than the page size
# Use the left scrollbar to scroll to the bottom of the page

It's not possible to scroll to the botton of the page.

h3. Workaround
* Collapse Advanced Settings to create repo
* Use the mouse scroller or keyboard arrow keys to scroll

h3. Tested with
* Chrome 58
* Firefox 53
fields.summary: Scrollbar does not fully scroll the page in create repo with advanced settings expanded

fields.description:
We have applied a software engineering process to code reviews of pull requests that involves numbering issues in comments on the code. When the issue is resolved on the branch of the PR, the developer will frequently refer to the issue number from the comment on the PR in their commit. However, making such a comment in a commit resolves an unrelated issue on the bitbucket issues list.

I believe it used to be that if you did not use a hashtag in the comment on the commit, this behavior of resolving a bitbucket issue in the issue tracker would not occur, as I have been unable to find past such commit comments that had this effect.  In order to have confidence in knowing what will happen as the result of entering free text in a comment, I believe it would be better to require hashtags on issue numbers in order to auto-resolve bitbucket issues.  Otherwise, there is a conceptual collision of issues in the issue tracker versus issues in a pull request comment.
fields.summary: Commenting in commits to resolve (unhashed) numbered issues in pull request comments changes status of unrelated project issues

ON code commit to repo it starts the pipeline and shows success in few seconds but there is no deployment ahppening.

image: amkor/docker-salesforce

clone:\\
depth: 5

pipelines:\\
default:\\
- step:\\
script:\\
- echo "Everything is awesome!" – ant -buildfile build/build.xml deployCode -Dsf.username=$SF_USERNAME -Dsf.password=$SF_PASSWORD -Dsf.serverUrl=$SF_SERVERURL - echo "Deployment Success!"
fields.summary: Unable to run the ANT deploy task in bitbucket pipeline

fields.description:

Example:

* Make issues page - public
* make a large commit to the remote Private repo, make a push to the remote to push the repo size over 1 GB
* ask a non-bitbucket account holder access the Public Issues page for that repo
* that person will see a size warning even though they do not have access to the repo or even hold a BB account

fields.description:
I am using pipeline (gradle) for automatic build process i.e to create EAR of my project, which itself internally uses two projects ( both are also on same URL hierarchy) i.e ProjectA(java projeect) and ProjectB (web-project), When my script tries to create EAR then it also creates jar and war of respective projects . I am able to successfully create EAR of my project which internally also have ear and jar. Now my same EAR project internally also used another project (java project) which is not in same hierarchy, actually it is independent project with its own repository. But i am not able to link that project from my EAR project.

Actually I am not able to create EAR file of my Referring Project, because while gradle compilation process, it cannot compile those classes which are using Referred Project classes. So In simple words, EAR internally needs jar of referred project at run-time.

Note:- I am creating this issue because Ronald Chia [support%40bitbucket.org] asked me to create issue, because this feature is not implemented yet.
fields.summary: Pipeline Gradle script to link external project as dependency

fields.description:
Bitbucket and git already log pushes and pull requests, but they do not log read-only activity. For private repositories containing sensitive code, knowing who had actually pulled the code as of a certain date/revision would be a valuable tool in tracking down unapproved code dissemination.

After granting access to a private repository, it would benefit the repository owner if Bitbucket logs:

* code browsing by that granted account via bitbucket web interface
* repository clone by that granted account
* repository pull by that granted account

Logs should include user, date, time, and code revision at a minimum.

If the private repository is marked "private forks only" then it would also be beneficial for Bitbucket to allow upstream review of who has access to the private forks and their activity (browse, clone, fetch, push). That is, if Coder B made a private fork of Coder A's repository, and then B gave C access to B's repository, then A would be interested in both B and C's access, even if it is read-only.

It is true that anyone who clones a repository could then share the code outside of Bitbucket, so this is not a complete code access tracking system, but implementing this kind of tracking would help with answering questions like:

* Who _could_ have released this code, which matches revision YYYYYY?
* Does person X still require access to this repository? Have they accessed the code at all in the last M months?
* Compared to the number of contributors, how many code readers do we have?

Code readers could indicate people involved in technical communications (e.g. documentation, technical marketing), but they could also be accidental invitations, people who've left the company, or untracked developers who should bring their code back into BitBucket.
fields.summary: Audit log: log read/clone/fetch access

fields.description:

fields.description:
Getting a "Bad Request" Error with API when Creating a Pull Request

{code}
#!bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -o errexit
set -o xtrace

curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
 -u {username}:{password}\
 https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/py-soft/sms_web/pullrequests \
 -d '{ "title": "Merge some branches", \
  "description": "stackoverflow example", \
  "source": { "branch": { "name": "TEST" }, \
  "destination": { "branch": { "name": "QA" } }, \
  "reviewers": [ { "username": "{username}" } ],\
   "close_source_branch": true }' > output.txt 2>&1
{code}

{code}
#!bash

  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed

  0     0    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--     0

100   267  100    11  100   256      3     87  0:00:03  0:00:02  0:00:01    87

fields.description: Build minutes get wasted if multiple pushes happen on the same branch. Only the most recent one should be allowed to complete. (This ideally would be a setting that could be toggled).

fields.description:
The repositories endpoint does not return any info about access controls applied to a repo (require 2sv or IP whitelisting).

As a result, there's no way to know about access controls restrictions without additional requests - which will just be blocked.

To help with this, the repositories endpoint should return access controls statuses.
fields.summary: Return per-repository access controls status in repositories endpoint

fields.description:
Please take a look at https://bitbucket.org/ngoctt/alcatel/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/%7Bbf4a12cd-68ea-4940-8dd2-c68c3f1871d4%7D

The process exited without any errors or exception too hard for me to debug\\
Below is my pipelines configuration

{code}
#!yaml

# This is a sample build configuration for PHP.
# Check our guides at https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/e8YWN for more examples.
# Only use spaces to indent your .yml configuration.
# -----
# You can specify a custom docker image from Docker Hub as your build environment.
image: php:7.0.18
pipelines:
  branches:
    master:
     - step:
        script:
         - echo "Debugging files is here or not" && ls -lat && pwd
         - echo "SSH client" && apt-get update && apt-get --assume-yes install openssh-client
         - echo "Run phpunit test" && php -d memory_limit=-1 ./vendor/phpunit/phpunit/phpunit -c ./deploy/phpunit.xml ./app/code
         - echo "Enable all Magento module" && php ./bin/magento module:enable --all
         - echo "Compiling coding" && php -d memory_limit=-1 -d max_execution_time=300 -d display_errors=1 -d display_startup_errors=1 ./bin/magento setup:di:compile -vvv
         - echo "Deploy static content" && php -d memory_limit=-1 -d max_execution_time=300 -d display_errors=1 -d display_startup_errors=1 ./bin/magento setup:static-content:deploy -vvv
         - echo "Download deployer" && curl -LO https://deployer.org/deployer.phar
         - echo "Run deployer to deploy on BC target" && php -d memory_limit=-1 deployer.phar --file=./deploy/deployer.php deploy development -vvv
{code}
fields.summary: Pipelines exit without throwing any errors or exception

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an account is on its plan limit, an admin cannot change a repo's Access type for a User or User group

h3. Environment to reproduce
_Team account:_ TeamA\\
One repository only in the team: repoA

_User groups:_

Administrators:

* User1
* User2

Developers:

* User3

Developers2:

* User4

All user groups have access to the repository.\\
Additionally, user5 has direct _Write_ repo access.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go the repoA >> Settings >> User and group access
# Try to change user5's access from Write to Read

Additionally:

h1. Try to change one of the user groups' access
h3. Expected Results
The Access type of the User or User group in questions changes accordingly

h3. Actual Results
The Access type doesn't change and the following error occurs: !2044597458-Screen%20Shot%202017-05-10%20at%2011.51.09.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
In case you are trying to change a User's access type:

# Remove a User group from the repo
# You should be able to change the user's access type now
# Add the User group you removed in step 1 back to the repo
fields.summary: When an account is on its plan limit, an admin cannot change a repo's Access type for a User or User group

fields.description: When an invitation is sent to the Bitbucket user's email alias (non primary email), the email prompts user to create a new Bitbucket account rather than granting the team/repo access to the existing account.
fields.summary: Invitations sent to email alias of a user prompts user to create a new Bitbucket account

fields.description:
When an account reaches the max plan limit, adding an existing user that is already within the plan count into another repository of the same account causes error:

"Not enough users on plan. The owner of this repository will need to upgrade their plan before this action can be completed."

Steps to reproduce:

# Have an account that reached the quota of the plan limit - say Plan limit: 5 / 5
# Add an existing user that is within the 5 user plan count into another repository within the same account.
# Error says "Not enough users on plan"

Expected behavior:\\
The existing user can be added into any amount of repositories within the same account.

----
The same issue can be reproduced with User groups.\\
I.e.:

# Have an account that reached the quota of the plan limit - say Plan limit: 5 / 5
# Add an existing user group that is within the 5 user plan count into another repository\\
within the same account.
# Error says "Not enough users on plan"

----
Additionally, adding an empty User group to a repo will give the same error.

h2. Notes:
At the moment, the issue occurs when trying to add an existing team member from the page of the specific 'User Group', e.g. https://bitbucket.org/account/user/TEAM_USERNAME/groups/administrators/

h2. Workaround:
# Open the 'User Groups' page of the team/account: https://bitbucket.org/account/user/TEAM_USERNAME/groups/
# Select the *Add Member* button on the top right corner

You'll be able to add an existing member to the team this way.
fields.summary: When an account reached the user limit, adding an existing user (or user group) that is already within the plan count into another repository of the same account causes error:

fields.description:
Places that show "Commit Date" is actually showing "Author Date". I believe it should be labelled as such, or at minimum simply "Date", to avoid confusion.

Myself and a felllow developer, after a batch of rebasing and cherry-picking in our projects, were doubting we were doing the right things because the "Commit Date" in both the "commits" list or "Network" display did not update. It was only when we confirmed it is actually the "Author Date" that it made sense. The fact that the displays were using the git-documented "Commit Date" inappropriately added to the confusion.
fields.summary: "Commit Date" shown is actually "Author Date"

fields.description:

fields.summary: Image embed in comments does not work if image name contains parenthesis ED-1643

fields.description:
When a branche contains one commit and a PR is made. Then the title is autofilled with the comments of this commit, instead of the title of the branche.

For example:

Branch with name "UTANG-74-get-cart-into-systemX" and commit "blalalalla"\\
While creating a PR "blalabal" will autoset as title instead of "UTANG-74-get-cart-into-systemX"

I expect "UTANG-74-get-cart-into-systemX" is set a title for the PR.

When there are >1 commits then the title is set to "UTANG-74-get-cart-into-systemX"
fields.summary: Autofill title of a PR always with branch name when  # commits = 1

fields.description:
When creating a branch in the bitbucket UI, you're only able to start from a branch.  I would like to be able to start from a tag.

!2388152044-bb-branch.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create Branch from Tag

fields.description: Current IP Whitelisting features only support HTTPS protocol and it will be best that it allow SSH Access as well.
fields.summary: IP Whitelisting: Support SSH access

fields.description:
Feature: Do not allow developers to download or access source code from their local laptops and from bitbucket.org accounts to secure our Intellectual Property (Source Code).

Use Case:\\
We give secured remote desktops to developers to do development work. Therefore, source code can be Checked IN and OUT only from these remote desktops.  No source code should be allowed to download from bitbucket.org accounts.
fields.summary: Access Control to Secure Intellectual Property (Source Code)

fields.description:
Render all wiki pages in the main repo (not the BitBucket repo Wiki) in MediaWiki format just like .md files are also rendered in the source view, and not just in the readme.md view.

In other words, currently .md files in the source view are rendered, but .wiki files are not.

The call is to enable rendering for repo wiki pages in the source view.

----
Alternatively you could also enable a configuration switch for changing this rendering to Creole syntax or to lobby with GitHub to enable it for theirs ;-). Creole seem to be preferable to Mediawiki, but in the aspect of interoperability and portability, main repo wiki pages should just all render in MediaWiki for now.
fields.summary: Render .wiki pages in source view also.

fields.description:
Switch the relative wiki link rendering from the mainpage readme.wiki (or even readme.md) depending on whether the repository's Wiki has been activated or not.

If the Wiki is activated, all wiki links should resolve to ../../<target> relative to the location of the readme.wiki / readme.md in the repository.

This is because the full URL would be:

https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/src/commit-id/readme.wiki

for the source file, and

https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/wiki/

for the target file.

If the Wiki is not activated, all wiki and md links should resolve into the current directory of readme.wiki. ie. the repo commit base url.

Also links into BCLOUD-14252 which creates extra erroneous path components that need to be fixed first, and BCLOUD-14253 that creates an unwanted /wiki/ subdirectory for every link.

If wiki links resolve to ../../<target> then the user needs to manually link to wiki/target file. This seems a better approach because ordinarily people would put their wiki files in a wiki subdirectory when the Wiki is not activated. Thus, when people manually link to [[wiki/target]] it would resolve to the BitBucket repo wiki when the Wiki is activated, and to their own wiki/ subdirectory when the wiki is not activated.

On the other hand if links directly resolve to ../../wiki/<target> then it becomes impossible to easily migrate between the two configuration options because it would make it impossible to use a wiki subdirectory in the main repo that would still operate nicely when turned to the BitBucket repo Wiki.
fields.summary: Resolve links in readme.wiki/readme.md based on activation of repo Wiki

fields.description:
Remove the relative "wiki" component from mainpage wiki links by default.

Any links made in any readme.wiki page will have a "mandatory" /wiki/ component to their target URL. This should be taken out. There is no reason for it to always link to a subdirectory.

Example:

https://bitbucket.org/dp_group/lxc-install/src/1b4bb29643a3a1bfb292c331b4758f29ef8abfbd/dp_group/lxc-install/wiki/bare.wiki

The /wiki/ was not inserted by the user. The actual link text was:

[[bare.wiki]]
fields.summary: Remove automatic /wiki/ subdir in wiki links from readme.wiki

fields.description:
Remove the <user>/<repo> or <team>/<repo> component from relative links in the main readme.wiki and readme.md pages.

Any ordinary wiki links in the readme.wiki get this structure:

https://bitbucket.org/<account>/<repository>/src/<commit-id>/<account>/<repository>/wiki/<target>

This is wrong. The last two components should be taken out. As an example (private repo):

https://bitbucket.org/dp_group/lxc-install/src/1b4bb29643a3a1bfb292c331b4758f29ef8abfbd/dp_group/lxc-install/wiki/bare.wiki

The right link should be:

https://bitbucket.org/<account>/<repository>/src/<commit-id>/wiki/<target>

Or:

https://bitbucket.org/dp_group/lxc-install/src/1b4bb29643a3a1bfb292c331b4758f29ef8abfbd/wiki/bare.wiki
fields.summary: Remove faulty components from wiki links from readme.wiki/readme.md

fields.description:
Hi,

When trying to view the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file from Pipelines Settings, it will redirect user to a page which shows 404 Error.

The View button has the URL which contains a "null" before the "bitbucket-pipelines.yml".

Sample URL :  https://bitbucket.org/USERNAME/repository_slug/src/null/bitbucket-pipelines.yml

The "bitbucket-pipelines.yml" file can be viewed if directly accessed from Source.

Thanks
fields.summary: View bitbucket-pipelines.yml file from Pipelines Settings shows 404.

fields.description:
Since we can link to commits, it would be great if there was a way to link to specific branches, too.\\
If I'm not mistaken, similar functionality already exists in JIRA, and I'd be happy to see it in the built-in bugtracker, too.
fields.summary: Feature Request: linking to branches

fields.description: Could you please start a manual gc on https://bitbucket.org/hpcunibas/huvishpc/? It is still huge after I purged the history!
fields.summary: Repository still huge after cleanup

fields.description:
----
h2. https://blog.bitbucket.org/2013/09/16/take-control-with-branch-restrictions/
h2. refers to
h2. https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Branch+management?_ga=2.70304720.1949455413.1493980111-85262580.1482918230
which results to 404

please redirect to correct url
fields.summary: 404 broken link in blog

fields.description:
# View a commit details page that has multiple file changes.
# Click on the first file.
# Scroll back to the top of the page.
# Click on the 2nd file.
# Press Back on the browser

The browser should jump to the anchor tag of the 1st file when the Back button is pressed. In the actual behavior, the browser does not do anything
fields.summary: Anchor links does not work properly with browser Back button

fields.description:
Hello,

I think that the build result in the pull request page doesn't have the\\
right importance it needs.

Many of my coworkers failed to notice that their build failed, some didn't even see that the result of the pipeline is displayed on the merge request page.
fields.summary: The pipeline result should be more visible in a pull request page

fields.description: There are some webhooks that are constant when we fork our base template, It would be nice to be able to copy the webhook from it's original repo when forkin. Or maybe a way to set default webhook for new repositories.
fields.summary: Copy webhooks when forking / Default Webhooks

fields.description:
Would be great to be able to force developers to only be able to use certain types of merge strategies.

In our case we want to disable all types of merge strategies except for squash. Currently some developers miss this and choose the default "merge", creating a very unclean history for our master branch. It also makes it difficult to cherry pick hotfixes from master branch to our specific release branch.

Please provide the option to choose which merge strategies are available in drop down when merging PRs!
fields.summary: Allow administrators to choose which merge strategies are allowed to be chosen

fields.description:
After creating a new repository in Bitbucket, there's only 2 options available:

* I have an existing project (which assumes the user already has a Git or Mercurial repository, although this is not clear from the title)
* I'm starting from scratch (which assumes the user doesn't have anything in the local machine)

There's a third option: that the user already has a code project locally, but is not versioned yet. In this case it's not specified what steps should they follow. It would be more clear if we specify in the first one that they should already have a repository (not just a project) and we add a third  option for those who are not yet using a Version Control system.
fields.summary: Include steps for how to start with an unversioned project

fields.description:
When adding users to one of our private git repositories on Bitbucket, the text completion offers users from the entire BitBucket user name space, not just our company's users.

Members of our company's team are identified with a "TEAM MEMBER" icon, but it is very easy to accidentally add an external user to a repository if names are similar.

The security ramifications of exposing our company's (and everyone else's!) proprietary code in this way are obvious.

This is a serious user interface bug and needs to be fixed.
fields.summary: Limit user searches for proprietary code to users in the Team

fields.description:
In the new UI, there is no Leave Team button.

As a workaround, users should navigate to [https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<team name>/leave-team/](https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<team name>/leave-team/) directly to leave the team.
fields.summary: Bitbucket new UI does not have a leave team button (BBCDEV-6646)

fields.description: Currently, we are showing only the commit author when viewing the 'raw commit' file in the UI. Due to the way we map commits, it would be more useful to show both fields to determine the actual committer in case of a default (or non-updated) .gitconfig file
fields.summary: Raw commit: Show committer and author in raw file

fields.description:
Currently, I don't see a way to set variables for specific builds through the api.

I know CircleCI currently has a feature like this that allows for build specific variables. I can't seem to find an option for this in any of the documentation.

For a reference, here is the CircleCI documentation:

https://circleci.com/docs/1.0/parameterized-builds/
fields.summary: Passing variables to pipelines through rest api

fields.description: When the confirmation popup for merging a pull request or any other similar modal pops, the contents are blury. I was able to remove the blurred effect by removing the transform: translateX and translateY on .aui-popup.bb-dialog
fields.summary: Blurry modal contents (BBCDEV-6450)

fields.description:
When we list users on the 'Plan details' screen, we only list users on a team who are given some level of access through a group.

You may be given a completely different number if you have users under a group who have no level of access (empty groups) and are not given access to a specific repository.

In conclusion, it can be confusing having different numbers on the team members overview vs. the plan details page
fields.summary: Team members screen doesn't always match the 'Plan details' screen

fields.description:
I want to use SauceLabs to test my product that runs across multiple Atlassian server products.

The Docker images have a hostname like

{{<baseurl>http://724babeb-d690-452c-aa9b-ef5660af34ae:5990/product</baseurl>}}

But that's not a URL available external to the container.

I would like to see something like

{{<baseurl>http://724babeb-d690-452c-aa9b-ef5660af34ae.pipelines.bitbucket.org:5990/product</baseurl>}}

So that external testing tools like Sauce Labs can access the running containers.

https://bitbucket.org/eddiewebb/statuspage-banner-atlassian-server/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/%7Bba811533-a428-4238-b66c-12bb6497909c%7D
fields.summary: Allow external access to containers running in Pipelines via a custom subdomain

fields.description:
I tried to clone the repo - it stops at around middle. If I fork the repo and then clone, it works.\\
!2300797060-bug_oip.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Repo not cloning

fields.description: As an admin, I like to keep myself updated on the users who has been added to the team to ensure no users are added to the group by accident.
fields.summary: Notification for admins when new users are added to team

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/snippets

When attempting to filter snippets, it only results in redirecting to the same page and does nothing.

!3182719695-Screen%20Shot%202017-05-02%20at%2011.55.16%20AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Dashboard snippets filter not working
Changing branch doesn't change default title in PR

fields.description:
I am looking at using pipelines to provide continuous deployment to both a testing and a live environment, using a separate Git branch for each. Using branch permissions, I can limit changes to the live branch to a subset of trusted users. However, when deploying with pipelines, a developer on the dev branch has the ability to copy the live deployment steps to the testing bitbucket-pipelines.yml file, and thus deploy testing code to the live environment. While this isn't likely to happen by accident, it's still a scenario that I'd like to prevent.

One way to solve this for my case is to limit environment variables (or SSH keys, but ideally there would be a key per environment, which currently is not supported in pipelines) similarly to branch permissions - either to a specific set of users, or to a specific branch (relying on the branch permission user limitations).

Alternatively, providing an option to always use the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file from the 'master' branch would solve this by preventing the 'testing' devs from being able to change the pipeline commands (by relying on branch permissions).

I see there is some discussion relating to this on BCLOUD-12844, but as that was opened nearly a year ago, I'm hoping to solve this problem somewhat sooner and hopefully without needing an external service.
fields.summary: Deployment security: Option to limit environment variables to a user or branch, or always use master's bitbucket-pipelines.yml

fields.description:
Hello Team,\\
We have been using Bitbucket and Bitbucket AWS CodeDeploy Addon.

Currently we are using Bitbucket for all our projects.\\
And each of our project have a dev, stage and production servers.\\
With the present Bitbucket addon configuration\\
I can only create one AWS Codedeploy configuration at a time.\\
eg: dev server profile.

if I have to run a stage or production deployment then I have to change the settings in "https://bitbucket.org/corratech/mvs/admin/addon/admin/bitbucket-aws-codedeploy/adminPage-223c62ab81646b51eb6b346895042767"

to that of stage or production.

is it possible to have multiple deployment profiles to be enabled.\\
such that during deployment we can use a "drop down list" to have our preferred  deployment instance selected.

Also it would be beneficial if we can set access permissions on certain deployment instances.\\
like production servers, you don't want to give deployment access to every one.

Thanks,\\
Anish
fields.summary: AWS CodeDeploy Configuration

fields.description:
Embedded SVG files support is critical for us to document technically our software. We were told by support that _for security reasons_, the feature will be soon _removed_. There are no security issues with private repository/*paid enterprise version* we are using (nobody can access the repository outside our company), so we are urging you NOT to drop the support, as it would have an extremely strong negative impact on the usability. We are using SVG files, that are commit/diff friendly, and can not easily switch to another format.

Note: this is targeted as a bug (regression)
fields.summary: Keep support for embedded SVG files on bitbucket repos

fields.description:
How can a team member find the team members with merge permissions for integration and release branches so they know who to contact to get PR merged? Currently it appears that only repo admin can see users with branch perms.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/using-branch-permissions-776639807.html

Raise support request and was asked to raise feature request.

https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-53398
fields.summary: As a team member I would like to see who has branch merge permissions so that I can know who to contact

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
* Create an issue with title "Old title"
* Change the issue title to "New title"

###Current output:

* a comment is generated reading "Changed title to 'New title'".

###Suggestion:

* a comment should be generated reading "Changed title from 'Old title' to 'New title'"
fields.summary: Old issue titles is not tracked

fields.description:
Yesterday I discovered that PyCharm's push operation has missed multiple changesets from my Hg repository, and pushed them manually to Bitbucket. Now the Commits page shows the seemingly unsorted list of changesets, with "2017-02-25" being above "yesterday" (today is 2017-05-01).

I believe, it sorts by push date rather than changeset date. If it's a feature, please make it possible to choose the sorting criterion. Otherwise please fix. Thanks.
fields.summary: Commits sorted by push date, not changeset date

fields.description:
At current state, if the repo did not have any commits, the "watch" repository option is not visible on the overviews page.

As a suggestion, it'd be great if users can go ahead and watch empty repositories first before the first commit is made.
fields.summary: Allow users to watch empty repositories

fields.description:
I noticed this yesterday, but it may have started a few days earlier: the website is missing key buttons and has layout errors to the extent that I can no longer use it for most tasks. Even this issue tracker page, see image below, note missing controls in left hand side.

I have tried Safari on both iPad and Mac, multiple projects and pages with the same effect. Login screen appears OK though. Is this a Safari compatibility issue, or has something become corrupted in my dashboard or something else happening?

!1036539441-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Website ('New Nav') Unusable on Old Safari
